column1: This course is designed for advanced undergraduate students with an interest in the interdisciplinary field of biophysics.  The course will focus on several subfields of biophysical chemistry, including: fluorescence as a tool in biophysics; protein folding; biophysical applications of single molecule fluorescence, atomic force microscopy, X-ray crystallography, mass spectrometry, and NMR spectroscopy.  Additional topics will be selected by students from a list of possible choices.
